content.question:

objectives.description: Identify effective strategies for finding job opportunities across different industries and channels.
Learn how to read and decode job descriptions to understand true requirements and expectations.
Develop techniques for tailoring application materials for specific positions and companies.
Learn best practices for online applications and Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).

terms.definition: Software used by employers to collect, sort, scan, and filter job applications based on keywords and qualifications.
terms.example: Up to 75% of resumes are filtered out by ATS before a human ever sees them

terms.definition: Specific terms in job descriptions that highlight required skills, qualifications, and experience that ATS scans for.
A document submitted alongside a resume that introduces the applicant and highlights relevant qualifications.
terms.example: Explains WHY you want this job and HOW your experience makes you the ideal candidate

terms.definition: Building professional relationships to exchange information, advice, support, and job referrals.
terms.example: ~70% of people land jobs through networking connections rather than applications alone

leftPanel.title: Resume Customization
paragraphs: 1. Prioritize Experience: Rearrange sections to highlight most relevant experience first
2. Integrate Keywords: Incorporate exact terms from the job description
3. Align Achievements: Emphasize accomplishments that demonstrate required skills
4. Tailor Summary: Customize your professional summary for each position

lists: Include exact keywords from job description

leftPanel.title: Why Follow Up?
paragraphs: Professional follow-up demonstrates your continued interest and proactive attitude.
Timing: Wait 1-2 weeks after the application deadline
Method: Email is typically most appropriate
Tone: Polite, brief, and professional
Content: Reference specific position, express interest, offer additional info

scenario.name: Alex: Strategic Job Search Approach in {{STATE_NAME}}
paragraphs: Alex, a recent computer science graduate, wanted a junior software developer position. Instead of randomly applying, he implemented a strategic approach:
Research: Identified companies known for mentoring junior developers.
Multi-Channel Search: Created alerts on 3 job boards, followed 15 target companies on LinkedIn, joined 2 local tech meetups.
Customization: For TechStart Inc., analyzed the job description, tailored resume to highlight relevant projects, and connected with an employee at a meetup.

scenario.name: Maya: ATS Optimization Success in {{STATE_NAME}}
paragraphs: Maya was applying for a digital marketing coordinator position with a major retail company. Knowing they used an ATS, she employed these strategies:
Formatting: Used clean template without graphics, standard sections, named file "Maya_Johnson_Marketing_Coordinator_Resume.docx"
Keywords: Incorporated exact terms: "social media management," "campaign analytics," "content creation," "SEO"
Quantified Results: "Increased Instagram engagement by 32%", "Managed $5,000 monthly ad budget with 45% CTR increase"
